isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 3200, 4100, 4200, 4300, 4400, 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 8500, 8600 Models Built After 05/19/2003 - ELECTRONIC GAUGE CLUSTER AND AUXILIARY GAUGE SWITCH PACK - REMOVE AND INSTALL - OPTIONAL GAUGES

svcproc.title: OPTIONAL GAUGES
svcproc.para: Refer to Typical EGC Circuit Board Gauge Connector Location

item.para: Remove the EGC from the instrument panel.
Remove six screws holding the back cover of the EGC in place.
Disconnect connectors for the optional gauge.
Remove two screws holding the gauge to EGC body and remove the gauge.

svcproc.para: Installation of the optional gauge is accomplished by reversing the removal procedure.

note.para: When adding a gauge that was not previously installed in the cluster, the electrical system controller must be programmed to recognize the gauge before the gauge will function. Refer to the ICAP programming software manual for details
